overview: From 2025-05-23 to 2025-05-24, elizaos/eliza had 30 new PRs (28 merged), 2 new issues, and 17 active contributors.

topIssues.title: RAG processFile attempts to embed entire files causing errors for large documents
topIssues.author: omikolaj
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

`ragknowledge.ts` file is running `embd` function on the entire content of the document, often causing errors with going over token limitations of the underlying model. The code attempts to embed the entire document, and then chunks it out.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create 'knowledge' directory in 'characters' directory.
2. Add a large pdf to the directory
3. Update *character.json file `knowledge` property to run embeddings on the file
4. Update *character.json file `settings.ragKnowledge` property to 'true'
5. Configure .env file to use `USE_OPENAI_EMBEDDING=true` and provide `OPENAI_API_KEY` and `EMBEDDING_OPENAI_MODEL=text-embedding-3-large` (or small)
6. Start the server, notice errors: 
```
[2025-03-02 15:14:48] ERROR: API Response: {
  "error": {
    "message": "This model's maximum context length is 8192 tokens, however you requested 16376 tokens (16376 in your prompt; 0 for the completion). Please reduce your prompt; or completion length.",
    "type": "invalid_request_error",
    "param": null,
    "code": null
  }
}
```

**Expected behavior**
All supported documents embedded without errors

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c1d4f359-74b9-4fe5-a38d-c90012a52f27)

**Additional context**

The code that does this was added on Jan5. It apppears to be in the latest release tag. Its possible Im setting something up wrong, but its not clear what.

topIssues.title: Ensure USE_LOCAL_AI is always true
topIssues.author: jmikedupont2
topIssues.body:
Hi team,
I am wondering about " Ensure USE_LOCAL_AI is always true" in v2,
in my small version I don't want to have local ai loaded.
If the user sets it to false, we should respect that.

topIssues.title: Task.World is redundant
topIssues.author: jmikedupont2
topIssues.body:
The world already is referenced from room and task references room, so we dont need to have world in task.
packages/plugin-sql/src/schema/tasks.ts
```
 worldId: uuid('world_id').references(() => worldTable.id, {
   onDelete: 'cascade',
 }),

```

topIssues.title: How can i handle the content response from the modell?
topIssues.author: transformer98

topIssues.title: RAG document Knowledge error (getCachedEmbeddings)
topIssues.author: retdude
topIssues.body: **Describe the bug** The application encounters multiple errors during knowledge processing: 1. Circuit breaker errors causing knowledge processing failures 2. UTF-8 encoding issues with PDF files 3. Database operation failures due to invalid byte sequences The errors occur during the initialization phase when processing character knowledge, particularly when handling PDF files and text content. **To Reproduce** 1. Put PDF knowledge in 'eliza/characters/knowledge/' 2. Set ragKnowledge to 'true' in your character file. 3. Edit your character file to add the knowlege like so: ``` "knowledge": [ { "directory": "tech_guides", "shared": true } ], ``` 4. Start the application using `pnpm start` 5. The errors appear during the knowledge processing phase 6. Specific errors include: - "invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00" - "Circuit breaker is OPEN" - "unsupported Unicode escape sequence" **Expected behavior** - PDF files should be properly processed without encoding errors - Knowledge processing should complete successfully - Circuit breaker should handle failures gracefully without blocking all operations **Screenshots** **Additional context** -Using PGVector for RAG - Environment: macOS 23.6.0 - The errors occur during the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) knowledge processing phase - The circuit breaker appears to be tripping due to database operation failures

topPRs.title: feat: add plugin-rag
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) plugin, enabling advanced document ingestion and retrieval capabilities.
  - Added support for uploading and processing various document types, including PDFs and DOCX, with asynchronous handling and per-file status reporting.
  - Integrated AI-powered text embedding and completion features using OpenAI and Anthropic models.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved handling of nullable fields in agent and task data to ensure consistent string values.

- **Documentation**
  - Added comprehensive documentation for the RAG plugin, including usage instructions, image requirements, and publishing guidelines.

- **Chores**
  - Updated dependencies and configuration files to support the new plugin.
  - Enhanced logging and error reporting for document processing and plugin operations.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: Knowledge Plugin
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR moves the code for knowledge into the RAG plugin and renames that to the knowledge plugin

So now the agent will be able to process knowledge optionally with the plugin installed, completely removing it from the runtime

publisher.ts was hardcoded to only handle @elizaos/ scoped packages, but it needed to work with any npm scope (like @yungalgo/, @username/, etc.).

Repository Name Extraction (Line ~298)
Test

Also cleans up some functions and improves type safety and file handling.

completedItems.title: Factor Knowledge Out to Plugin and Add Service Registry Types
completedItems.body:
This PR moves all knowledge functionality out of the runtime and into the plugin-knowledge

In additional, adds a service registry pattern so that external plugins can have typed Services referenced elsewhere
